title: First Day at the Coffee Shop
description: It's your first day as a barista! Can you impress your boss and keep the customers happy? Learn essential English for customer service.

text: You arrive at 'The Daily Grind' cafe for your first day. Your boss, a friendly woman named Maria, smiles.
'Good morning! Welcome. Are you ready for your first day?'
'Don't worry, it's normal. Just be polite and listen carefully.'
'When you are ready, call your first customer.'

shift_start.text: The morning rush is about to begin. The counter is clean.

customer_1_start.text: A friendly man walks up. 'Good morning. Can I get a large black coffee, please?'

feedback.fail: Não foi bem isso. O pedido foi 'large black coffee'. Tente de novo.

customer_1_challenge_2_unscramble.text: Challenge 2: Unscramble. The man asks how much it costs. Ask him 'Can you pay at the cashier?'.
customer_1_challenge_2_unscramble.correctAnswer: can you pay at the cashier?

feedback.fail: Quase lá! A ordem das palavras é muito importante.

customer_1_challenge_3_fill.text: Challenge 3: Fill the Blank. He nods. 'Of course. You are very helpful. Have a good ____.'

feedback.success: Isso mesmo! 'Day' é a palavra correta.
feedback.fail: Uma palavra comum para desejar algo bom para alguém é 'day' (dia).

customer_1_success.text: First customer done! That went well.

customer_2_start.text: A tourist with a camera looks at you. 'Hello. I want one small tea.'

customer_2_challenge_2_unscramble.text: Challenge 2: Unscramble. She asks for something to eat. Ask her 'Anything else?'.

feedback.fail: Tente de novo. É uma pergunta com duas palavras.

customer_2_challenge_3_fill.text: Challenge 3: Fill the Blank. She points to a cake. 'Yes, that looks very ____. I will take one.'

feedback.success: Exato! 'Good' (bom) é a palavra perfeita aqui.
feedback.fail: Uma palavra simples para dizer que algo parece saboroso é 'good'.

customer_2_success.text: You give the tea and cake to the tourist. She is very happy. 'Thank you!'

options.text: Say 'You're welcome!' and call the next customer.

customer_3_start.text: A teenager looking at his phone says quickly: 'I need to charge my phone.'

options.text: Show him where the outlet is.

customer_3_challenge_1_copy.text: Challenge 1: Copy. He says 'Thank you'. You should reply 'You're welcome'. Write that down.

feedback.fail: A resposta para 'Thank you' é 'You're welcome'.

customer_3_challenge_2_unscramble.text: Challenge 2: Unscramble. Now he wants to order. Ask him 'What can I get for you?'.
customer_3_challenge_2_unscramble.correctAnswer: what can I get for you?

feedback.fail: Essa é uma frase muito comum em atendimento.

customer_3_challenge_3_fill.text: Challenge 3: Fill the Blank. He says, 'Just a bottle of ____, please.'

customer_3_success.text: You give him the water. He nods. 'Thanks.'

ending_perfect.title: Final Perfeito: Barista Natural!
ending_perfect.text: You were fast, correct, and friendly with every customer. Maria is very impressed. 'Amazing work today! You are a natural.' Congratulations!

ending_medium.title: Final Mediano: Bom Começo
ending_medium.text: You survived your first day. You made some mistakes, but you helped your customers and learned a lot. Tomorrow is a new day to improve. Good job.

ending_bad.title: Final Ruim: Um Dia Caótico
ending_bad.text: Your first day was a mess. Customers were confused and you made many mistakes. You have a lot to learn, but at least you finished the day.
